intro: Corydalis turtschaninovii f. papillosa, commonly known as the papillate corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine, hair-like structures, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variant is a naturally occurring form of the species, distinguished by its unique floral and foliar characteristics. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
